mdRecord.dcterms:title: Glass perfume bottle
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jean Vincent Bully [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Glass bottle bearing 4-sided label in French. Front label reads, in part: "AU TEMPLE DE FLORE; TOILET VINEGAR OF JEAN VINCENT BULLY; ALCOHOL 69%; MÃ©dailles aux Expositions universelles; HORS CONCOURS EN 1889." Bottle owned by August C. Camoriani (1906-1973), a pharmacist who was born and died in San Francisco. He was the owner of Rossi Drug Co. San Francisco, CA and "Mayor of North Beach" the "Little Italy" neighborhood. He served the Italian immigrant community of San Francisco for more than 40 years.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
Donated by the Estate of Eric Blum; conveyer: Harriet Nash [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Bottles
